applyTo: '**/*.html'

# HTML Coding Standards

## General Guidelines

- Indent nested elements with 2 spaces for better readability
- Use semantic HTML5 elements (e.g., `<header>`, `<nav>`, `<main>`, `<section>`, `<article>`, `<footer>`) to improve accessibility and SEO
- Ensure proper nesting of HTML elements
- Use lowercase for all HTML tags and attributes
- Always include the `lang` attribute in the `<html>` tag to specify the language of the document
- Use double quotes for attribute values
- Always include a `<title>` tag within the `<head>` section
- Use `<meta charset="UTF-8">` to specify character encoding
- Include a viewport meta tag for responsive design: `<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">`
- Use `<alt>` attributes for all `<img>` tags to improve accessibility
- Avoid using inline styles; prefer external CSS for styling
- Use `<label>` elements for form inputs to enhance accessibility
- Ensure that all interactive elements (e.g., buttons, links) are keyboard accessible
- Use ARIA roles and attributes where necessary to improve accessibility
- Validate HTML using tools like W3C Markup Validation Service to ensure code quality and standards compliance
- Regularly review and refactor HTML to remove unused or redundant code
